channel.title: What I worked on before I left
channel.description:
I have been away for some time. I had alot of bad stuff last year. Avatarium dieing, runeStatus crumbling, rune-server turning bad. So I Left! I made a server from scratch. Client.java is not the main file. The client.java was only 7kb. the class was 3kb. However is had alot of lagg. I might work on it again. Thank god no client.java. It uses 1 void to load cfgs btw. I took the example of rscd for handling packets. It seemed good. However my source is currently not as powerful as these servers you have today. Done: -Logging in -Walking -Trading -Attacking -Dieing -Banking -Loging character files into a folder. Outline of files:
Player: Variable storage for a SINGLE player, instanced. PlayerManager: Updates ALL players. NPC: Variable storage for a SINGLE NPC, instanced. NPCManager: Updates ALL NPCS. World: Variable storage for the WHOLE world, includes Items, Objects. WorldManager: Updates all things like Object Locations, Items on the ground. Client: A SINGLE players connection to there Client and are Server. ClientManager: Updates all the information sent and recv from are Server and there Client. PacketList: Takes the packets we get from ClientManager and performs the actions for a SINGLE player, instanced, this also sets player flags and what not, this class should have EVERY PLAYER SPECIFIC class from here on, such as Banking, and Equipment. Database: Manages the PRE LOADING of are data into there classes on startup. Server: Listens for connections and deals with them in the correct manor, also creates the MASTER PROCESS.
Those are the main ones OUTLINE: BAD And no there are no shops or npcs [they are worked on]. You might say its crap. But hey, No one bothers to do anything except copy paste. [u]Copying and Pasting is not coding.[/u] --------------------------------------------------- lol no replys people are all self-centered in their coping and pasting.

item.title: What I worked on before I left
item.dc:creator: @kiwon kiwon
item.description:
@kiwon wrote:

Good job. But this was suppose to be about what?

Just to show off what you have so far?

=]

Read full topic

item.title: What I worked on before I left
item.dc:creator: @Silentone Silentone
item.description:
@Silentone wrote:

I have been away for some time. I had alot of bad stuff last year. Avatarium dieing, runeStatus crumbling, rune-server turning bad. So I Left!

I made a server from scratch. Client.java is not the main file. The client.java was only 7kb. the class was 3kb.

However is had alot of lagg. I might work on it again. Thank god no client.java. It uses 1 void to load cfgs btw.

I took the example of rscd for handling packets. It seemed good. However my source is currently not as powerful as these servers you have today.

Done:

-Logging in
-Walking
-Trading
-Attacking
-Dieing
-Banking
-Loging character files into a folder.

Outline of files:

Player: Variable storage for a SINGLE player, instanced.

PlayerManager:
Updates ALL players.

NPC:
Variable storage for a SINGLE NPC, instanced.

NPCManager:
Updates ALL NPCS.

World:
Variable storage for the WHOLE world, includes Items, Objects.

WorldManager:
Updates all things like Object Locations, Items on the ground.

Client:
A SINGLE players connection to there Client and are Server.

ClientManager:
Updates all the information sent and recv from are Server and there Client.

PacketList:
Takes the packets we get from ClientManager and performs the actions for a SINGLE player, instanced, this also sets player flags and what not, this class should have EVERY PLAYER SPECIFIC class from here on, such as Banking, and Equipment.

Database:
Manages the PRE LOADING of are data into there classes on startup.

Server:
Listens for connections and deals with them in the correct manor, also creates the MASTER PROCESS.

Those are the main ones
OUTLINE: BAD

And no there are no shops or npcs [they are worked on]. You might say its crap. But hey, No one bothers to do anything except copy paste.

Copying and Pasting is not coding.

lol no replys people are all self-centered in their coping and pasting.

Read full topic
item.source: What I worked on before I left
